page.title: 18PUBLIC NURSERY,COOK GALLERY
page.content: There are 2 public nurseries in this area, one belongs to the island and one to the Parish of St.Helier. Both have their own water supplies.{The {States Nursery}covers 36 vergees (6.4 hectares). It supplies shrubs, trees and flowers to schools,parks and housing estates, and floral decorations to public buildings for special occasions.{The St.Helier {Nurseries}cover 10 vergees and supply the Parade, St.Andrews Park and La Collette.{ {The Sir Francis Cook Gallery}belongs to the{Jersey Heritage Trust.}It is in {Trinity}about a mile North of St. Helier and used to be a Methodist chapel and schoolroom. Sir Francis Cook bought it in the 1970s to house his paintings. He died in 1978 before changes were completed. In 1984 it was given to the public in his memory.
